Description: Rod-formed glass pendant in the form of a ram's head. Opaque white with horns of twisted opaque white and opaque brown, curled back over and under the head; eyes outlined in opaque white with opaque brown pupils.
Curator's comments: BM Glass Unpublished. For the excavations, see A. S. Murray in Archaol. Anzeiger 1898, 238 (who mentions tomb 14 and some of its contents, but not this object), and Myres and Richter 1899, 11, 187f.
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (436)
Condition: Broken and mended; suspension-ring lost, snout broken and horns partly missing.
